__e: [Anna] I work with hundreds of kids, so I know when they're lying and when they're not.
Numbers don't lie, and facts are indeed facts, but sometimes, we need to trust each other, because the truth isn't always what it appears to be.
Somebody once told me that everybody lies, and since you're the only people who know he has cancer...
Do we let them mention our mothers?
This is what happens when kids lie to their parents.
I know kids lie to their parents about stuff, but you don't do that.
Everybody has something to lie about... which means we have nothing.
Because no one wants to tell their parents they lied about something like that.
We never know if it's big or not, cos women lie to us about our dicks so much, we don't know what the fuck we got.
And therein lies a lot of what the problem is, in all honesty.
Everybody out there is lying to get what they want; why can't we?
You know, let's of people lie to you to take your money, but nobody ever said that guy over there, right over there, he knows your daughter.
